body:
This looks great overall, thanks! A few questions:

1) Do we really need to make the LookupContext change? The lookup context exists just in the request life-cycle, it is not shared in between requests.

2) I don't like the Resolver change. Instead of having 4 nested hashes each with its lock, maybe we should simply have one hash/cache and use an array with 4 elements as key. Can we have some benchmarks in that code to show which one is faster?

3) Many of the changes done here are simply a cache. Using a structure with a mutex for such cases in MRI is an unnecessary overhead, since a simple Hash would be fine because we don't care if two different threads eventually execute the same piece of code. What do you think? Can we have a structure that complies with this?
